data.title: [Feature Request] Undo branches

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Undo branches / undo tree allows you to undo some changes,
then make a new change, while keeping all changes available in the undo tree.
The undo tree can therefore prevent awkward scenarios such as:
 * Losing all redo futures by accidentally pressing a button during undo
 * Copying the file or save it with git when trying multiple alternatives

This screen-cap showcases how it works in Emacs with undo-tree.

![wpid-undo-tree1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/908496/23103901/811d0352-f6c3-11e6-8dfa-b8690faa034f.gif)

https://github.com/Zalastax/vscode/commit/c5699711d21dece88c7c608f6d8ae277f72a0081 contains the changes to the model that are needed, but several questions remain to be answered. I'm interested in completing the feature but need further input before proceeding.
* How should the UI look? Graphics / ASCII, clickable?
* Should the tree be formatted like in Emacs undo-tree (as short tree as possible) or like Vim's Gundo http://screenr.com/M9l (one state per line sorted by time)?
* What unit-tests should be added?

You can try out the current changes by compiling my fork and you'll find 'History Tree' in the Edit menu. Clicking the menu item will console.log a function that changes what redo future is selected (just like in the gif).

data.title: Insiders build: installing any npm module fails
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: Version1.10.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 Professional

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a JavaScript project in VS Code Insiders
2. Open the integrated terminal or an external command prompt (does not matter if administrative or not).
3. Try to install an npm module from the integrated resp. external terminal, e.g. `npm install --save-dev enzyme`
4. The installation fails because some files cannot be renamed (while VS Code is running, see workaround):
```
npm ERR! Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, rename 'C:\Users\jose\Documents\GitHub\d-portal\node_modules\.staging\domutils-5643046d' -> 'C:\Users\jose\Documents\GitHub\d-portal\node_modules\enzyme\node_modules\domutils'
npm ERR!  { Error
npm ERR!     at destStatted (C:\Users\jose\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\npm\lib\install\action\finalize.js:29:7)
npm ERR!     at C:\Users\jose\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\npm\node_modules\graceful-fs\polyfills.js:284:29
npm ERR!     at FSReqWrap.oncomplete (fs.js:111:15)
npm ERR!
npm ERR! Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, rename 'C:\Users\jose\Documents\GitHub\d-portal\node_modules\.staging\domutils-5643046d' -> 'C:\Users\jose\Documents\GitHub\d-portal\node_modules\enzyme\node_modules\domutils' parent: 'enzyme' }
npm ERR!
npm ERR! Please try running this command again as root/Administrator.
``` 

**Current workaround**: Close VS Code and run the install from an external command line.

data.title: Create missing intermediate pathname components for new folders
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.3

This is a small feature request that would be useful when creating a new folder from the Explorer tab.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to the Explorer (_View_ menu â†’ _Explorer_)
2. Click on the _New folder_ button
3. Type a name like `folder/subfolder`

Result: an error message like _The name folder/subfolder is not valid_ is shown.

Expected result: the folder _subfolder_ could be created inside the folder _folder_.

Notes:

* What I am describing here would be the equivalent of the Unix `mkdir -p` command
* SublimeText works this way when creating folders.

data.title: Debug Batch (.bat) files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The Powershell extension enables debugging (https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/heyscriptingguy/2017/02/13/debugging-powershell-script-in-visual-studio-code-part-2/) which is a really neat. Unfortunately we still have a lot of older scripts at work due to legacy Win XP machines.

Does a similar functionality exist for Batch (.bat) files? I couldn't find any extension and there doesn't appear to be any built in functionality other than syntax highlighting.

data.title: Implement #12910
data.body:
As mentioned in #12910 arbitrary sorting is currently not available for installed extensions. This PR will implement the functionality required to arbitrarily sort installed extensions. This PR ironically also allows extensions from the gallery to be sorted by name.

- [x] Allow sorting installed extensions by name both ascending and descending.
- [x] Allow sorting installed extensions by install count both ascending and descending.
- [x] Allow sorting installed extensions by rating both ascending and descending.

data.title: "files.associations" does not recognize upper case letters and lower case letters
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1 2017-02-08 AMD64
- OS Version: lubuntu ( kernel: 4.8.0-22-generic) 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. set "files.associations" to the same word but one in upper case and one in lower case
2. open two files one with the upper case extension and another with the lower case extension
3. vscode language mode will say they both use the first mode in "files.associations" list

// settings.json
`{
    "files.associations": {
        "*.h": "css",
        "*.H": "html"
    }
}`

// a.h ( language mode: css ) this one is correct
// a.H ( language mode: css ) should be html

// settings.json
`{
    "files.associations": {
        "*.H": "html",  // Swap h and H
        "*.h": "css"
    }
}`

// a.h ( language mode: html ) should be css 
// a.H ( language mode: html ) this one is correct

data.title: Inline Comment Incorrectly Applied in JSX Attribute Properties
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a file with .js extension
2. Type a JSX tag with a spread attribute
```
<Foo {...{
  bar: 'baz'
}} />
```
3. Select the second line `bar: 'baz'`
4. Apply "Add Line Comment" command

Expected: A line comment is applied `// bar: 'baz'`
Actual: A JSX JavaScript expression is applied with block comment `{/* bar: 'baz' */}`.
Issue: The applied comment is not valid syntax in this context.

data.title: "Rename Symbol" in unsaved file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: **1.9.1**
- OS Version: **Windows 10 Pro x64 v1607**

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open VS Code, then create a new file [Ctrl + N]
2. Copy & Paste some sample codes.
3. Try to rename a symbol by using F2 / "Rename Symbol" feature.

**Expected:** we can quickly rename the symbol in the current tab / file.
**Actual:** See a warning _"File not found (\untitled:Untitled-1)"_

**User Story:**
I was so glad to know that [Hot Exit feature](https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_8#_hot-exit) has been added to VS Code since version 1.8.1 (I like this feature since the last time with Sublime Text). I usually write some codes in draft mode and throw them after done. Ex: playground, solving coding challenges. Although I will throw them away, I still want to refactor them while coding and make the code easier to read. So, I hope the intelligent of "Rename Symbol" feature would be improved soon.

**Edit:** After sent this issue, I suddenly realize that I could save a playground file on my Desktop to support my use cases. However, it still depends on VS Code Team's decision to improve this feature or not.

data.title: How to show suggestion every key input using provideCompletionItems?
API: provide a wrapper for electron `printToPdf` function
data.body:
Could it be possible to expose the [`printToPdf`](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/web-contents/#contentsprinttopdfoptions-callback) API provided by electron?
It's very useful for extensions who want to save preview to file.
As a 'native' solution, it's better than that such as [node-html-pdf](https://www.npmjs.com/package/html-pdf) in many aspects (such as quality and no other required lib).

data.title: IntelliSense duplicate method as property in completion and miss parameters
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: MacOs Sierra 10.12.3
Tested with no extensions / no personal config.

Steps to Reproduce:

In a javascript file :
1. type :
```
//     cursor v
"String".toLow|
```
2. press "**tab**"
3. give the result : 
```
//           cursor v
"String".toLowerCase|
```
Expected parenthesis : 
```
//             cursor v
"String".toLowerCase( | )
```

The problem seems to be intellisense consider all exported functions as property too.
It result in a duplicate suggestion, one good, and the other broken. The problem is that the broken one is considered first.

Here is an example, we can show twice the same completion. The second do the job but the first (default) is crap : 
![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5599375/23098297/b8517354-f64a-11e6-8a1c-dda00b36b5b2.gif)

How can i disable the first or priorize the second ?

data.title: Quick FTP
data.body:
Again about FTP.
I think we need decision, that:

1.  main VSC developers **want support this feature or not** and leave this for:
2.  external extensions which exist or can be developed other (maybe bether than exist)
3.  external extensions as own support to solve basic problem what exist in point 2

- [ ] We need **FTP manager as global list of ftp accounts** (should not be as dedicated config.json for main project, easy to disclose secret access data to the servers [login/pass]) 
- [ ] should work similiar as **FTP Explorer** but on remote server 
- [ ] Search, Listing dirs and files
- [ ] **CHMOD** edit options + automaticly add default CHMOD for some files/dir (if edit or created) if need (eg. execute for .py - very often issue on ftp clients - that after upload/changes we must manulay change CHMOD to set execute mode for file)
- [ ] Can be as next icon "qFTP" (Quick FTP [ctr+shift+q]) under "Extensions" icon
- [ ] some backup/tmp philosophy for files (including undo, redo) if saved files in live mode was was done with mistake
- [ ] Sync (exist plugins but this is far from all **Qucik FTP Explorer** )

4. I know about
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/18186
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13643

5. Main question - is exist some problem to create extensions as full explorer (clone for ftp), eg. no support from API?

Steps to Reproduce:

3. Can't close unwanted files from the list. Have to go to them individually. Would be useful if you could close them directly from the list.
